item.title: Hugo
item.description:
Basic Setup

Hugo is a tool for converting markdown to HTML. It is actually quite straight forward, too! To create a new site you simply run

hugo new site <name>

and then you have a simple site! You can create a page using

hugo new content <path/to/content.md>

For example, you could create the Markdown file “Hugo” in directory content by running

hugo new content Hugo.md

Easy-peasy! WHen creating files within Hugo itself files are automatically given YAML front-matter. This page uses

item.title: Esperanto
item.description:
Grammar

![][https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M-TioyqRO9o]

Summary:

  • SVO Structure
    • Objects marked with -n, the accusative case
  • Nouns marked with -o
  • Adjectives marked with -a
  • One article, la
    • La is definite, or ’the'
      • “Mi havas la libro” -> I have the book
    • There is no indefinite article
      • “Mi havas libro” -> I have a book
  • Plurality is marked with -j, similar to the English -s
  • Adverbs marked with -e
    • -e can also mean “In the”
      • “Urbo” -> City
      • “Urbe” -> In the city
  • Conjugation
    • Infinitive -> -i
    • Past -> -is
    • Present -> -as
    • Future -> -os
    • Conditional -> -us
    • Imperative -> -u
  • Adjectives usually before noun
